It looks like Closure will finally find their way into Java. With this feat=
ure many nice ways to do thing become possible. Therefore I am wondering if=
 other people agree that it might be time for a JUnit5 putting this new fea=
ture to good use.

A source for inspiration for me in this regard are the F=
unSuite of ScalaTest http://www.scalatest.org/getting_started_with_fun_suit=
e

There a test definition is a method call (instead of a method definition=
 in JUnit) that registers a test for execution. It looks roughly like this:=



class MyTestClass{

    test("The test name"){
        // the actual tes=
t goes here 
    }
}

With this approach things like Rules become extremly =
trivial, since all you have to do is wrap the code block (i.e. closure) in =
a new new code block. 

Also parameterized test become fairly easy, because=
 you would just put the call to test in a loop.

What do you think? Is this=
 an interesting direction for JUnit to go?
